background.description: Use as the primary background for the UI.

primary.description: Use for the background of actionable cards.

secondary.description: Use for the background of actionable cards.

secondaryPressed.description: Use for the background of actionable cards.

backgroundPressed.description: Use as the primary background for the UI.

primaryPressed.description: Use for the background of actionable cards.

default.description: Use for the background of elements used to reinforce our brand, but with more emphasis.

pressed.description: Use for the background of elements used to reinforce our brand, but with more emphasis.

selected.description: The selected state color for fold-tier elements.

default.description: Use for the background of elements that appear to have no background in a resting state, such as subtle buttons and menu items.

pressed.description: Use for the background of elements that appear to have no background in a resting state, such as subtle buttons and menu items.

selected.description: The selected state color for fold-tier elements.

default.description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information, such in error section messages.

pressed.description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information, such in error section messages.

selected.description: Use for backgrounds communicating critical information, such in error section messages.

default.description: A vibrant background option for communicating critical information, such as in danger buttons and error banners.

pressed.description: A vibrant background option for communicating critical information, such as in danger buttons and error banners.

selected.description: A vibrant background option for communicating critical information, such as in danger buttons and error banners.

default.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favorable outcome, such as in success section messages.

pressed.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favorable outcome, such as in success section messages.

default.description: A vibrant background option for communicating a favorable outcome, such as in checked selectors.

pressed.description: A vibrant background option for communicating a favorable outcome, such as in checked selectors.

default.description: A vibrant background option for neutral UI elements, such as announcement banners.

pressed.description: A vibrant background option for neutral UI elements, such as announcement banners.

selected.description: A vibrant background option for neutral UI elements, such as announcement banners.

disabled.description: Use for backgrounds of elements in a disabled state.

pressed.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favorable outcome, such as in success section messages.

default.description: Use for backgrounds communicating a favorable outcome, such as in success section messages.

pressed.description: A vibrant background option for communicating a favorable outcome, such as in checked selectors.

default.description: A vibrant background option for communicating a favorable outcome, such as in checked selectors.

primary.description: Primary text, such as body copy, sentence case headers, and buttons.

secondary.description: Secondary text, such as navigation, subtle button links, input field labels, and all caps subheadings.

tertiary.description: Meta-data, breadcrumbs, input field placeholder and helper text.

negative.description: Use for critical text, such as input field error messaging.

positive.description: Use for text to emphasize caution, such as in migration message.

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled state.

inverse.description: Use for text on bold backgrounds.

secondary.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as flat cards or side panel dividers.

negative.description: Use for borders communicating critical information, such as the borders on invalid text fields.

positive.description: Use for borders communicating a favorable outcome, such as the borders on validated text fields.

disabled.description: Use for borders of elements in a disabled state.

focused.description: Use for focus rings of elements in a focus state.

inverse.description: Use for borders on bold backgrounds.

tertiary.description: Use to visually group or separate UI elements, such as flat cards or side panel dividers.
